intro: Fordiophyton fordii var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy horse chestnut, is a variant of the horse chestnut tree native to China. It is characterized by its hairy, pubescent leaves and distinctive, spiny fruits. The plant belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained, fertile soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
